title: Who sang the song: 'At Last'? - Quora

response.answer_text: At Last is a 1941 song written by Mack Gordon and Harry Warren. It was performed in the film Orchestra Wives and on record by Ray Eberle and Pat Friday. The music was provided by Glenn Miller and his orchestra.  It later became Etta James' signature song and first appeared on her debut album, also called At Last, in 1961. James' version is generally the most well-known and oft-heard and used version.  It's been covered a number of times by various artists, including (but not limited to)... Percy FaithGene WatsonCeline DionLiberty SilverBeyonceChristina AguileraCyndi LauperJason MrazLou Rawls & Diane Reeves

“At last” my love has come along... One of the most beautiful woman with one of the most powerful voices… Ms. Etta James! I've got 3 of her CD's and play often. My most favorite song that brought out so much definition of myself of who I was, am and always will be was! Proud of myself that I proved to myself regardless of situations, circumstances, no matter where I go or where I end up! In the end it's my face that I see looking back at me! And as long as my conscious is clear my face will always be beautiful! 'Almost persuaded’
